header_summary: Dr Maxim Orlovsky plans to create a simplified paper explaining the application of their generic model, "Prometheus," to a specific case of two-way peg. Sergi Delgado Segura announces the Bitcoin Research Day event, which aims to bring together researchers and developers to discuss Bitcoin's robustness, security, and decentralization. Lightning talks slots are available for those interested in presenting ongoing research. ZmnSCPxj discusses the need for `SIGHASH_ANYPREVOUT` in a specific context and explores alternative ways to ensure single-use. Vincenzo Palazzo introduces the Lightning Network Interoperability Initiative, which focuses on integration testing and stress testing to ensure compliance and compatibility among different implementations. Sergi Delgado Segura announces the upcoming Bitcoin Research Day event again, inviting participation from the bitcoin-dev and lightning-dev communities. ZmnSCPxj proposes the concept of sidepools on the Lightning Network to manage liquidity allocation and suggests implementing channel factories and sidepools to enhance scalability.

recent_posts.title: Trustless 2-way-peg without softfork
recent_posts.summary:
- Dr Maxim Orlovsky received feedback on their proposal, suggesting they create a simpler paper.
- The feedback emphasized the need to explain the application of the proposed model, "Prometheus," to a specific two-way peg case.
- Dr Maxim Orlovsky plans to work on this task and share it with the mailing list soon.

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Research Day 2023
recent_posts.summary:
- The email announces the Bitcoin Research Day at Chaincode in Midtown NYC on October 27th, 2023.
- The event invites researchers and developers to discuss the robustness, security, and decentralization of Bitcoin.
- Lightning talk slots are available and participants from the Bitcoin and Lightning Network communities are welcome to RSVP.

recent_posts.title: Actuarial System To Reduce Interactivity In N-of-N (N > 2) Multiparticipant Offchain Mechanisms
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses loose interactivity and the need for `SIGHASH_ANYPREVOUT` in a specific context.
- Participants other than the actuary generating a single public key raises concerns.
- The actuary bonding a significant amount of funds to each participant is a challenge.

recent_posts.title: Announcing the Lightning Network Interoperability Initiative
recent_posts.summary:
- Vincent has developed the "Lightning Network Interoperability Initiative" to ensure protocol compliance.
- This initiative aims to create language-agnostic tools for integration tests and stress testing.
- Vincent invites the community to visit their documentation site and contribute feedback and ideas.

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Research Day 2023
recent_posts.summary:
- The email announces the Bitcoin Research Day conference, happening on October 27th, 2023.
- The event aims to gather researchers and developers for discussions on Bitcoin's system.
- There will be longer format talks and lightning talks for ongoing projects presentations.

recent_posts.title: Sidepools For Improving Payment Reliability At Scale
recent_posts.summary:
- The sender discusses the difficulty of predicting liquidity allocation on the Lightning Network.
- They propose the concept of sidepools as a solution for mis-allocating funds.
- Sidepools help maintain liquidity, preserve privacy, and support scalability on the Lightning Network.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- We are implementing a version of 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2 for statechains.
- The server (party 1) will be fully 'blinded' and will not learn the aggregate information.
- The security of blinded statechains relies on trusting the server to report partial signatures.

active_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions"
active_posts.summary:
- The maximum block size of 4MB and a 10-minute block time amounts to 210.24GB growth per year.
- A 5TB hard drive costing less than $150 can provide storage for 21 years.
- Hardware costs decrease over time and optimization efforts reduce storage requirements for individual nodes.

active_posts.title: Concrete MATT opcodes
active_posts.summary:
- Salvatore Ingala presents a completed proposal for MATT opcode core functionality in the bitcoin-inquisition repo.
- The proposal includes replacing OP_CHECK{IN, OUT}CONTRACTVERIFY with a single opcode, OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY (CCV).
- OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY introduces additional parameters and modifies the order of parameters for better script writing.

active_posts.title: Resumable channels using OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal introduces a new way to make lightning channels resumable from a wallet seed.
- It addresses the issue of channel backups and provides a solution for fraud proofs.
- The proposal also suggests saving bandwidth and includes some concluding remarks about alternative options.

active_posts.title: LN Summit 2024 Organization
active_posts.summary:
- Antoine Riard, a Lightning Network developer, proposes organizing the LN Summit in Africa in June 2024.
- He emphasizes transparent and accountable actions and invites objections or feedback for his involvement.
- Antoine plans to survey suitable countries, such as Algeria, Ghana, Senegal, and Nigeria, for hosting the summit.

active_posts.title: Remotely control your lightning node from your favorite HSM
active_posts.summary:
- Bastien TEINTURIER submitted a pull request to the bLIPs repository to document an idea.
- He proposes using an HSM as a whitelisted lightning peer to securely send admin commands.
- This architecture requires minimal changes to the lightning node, utilizing a standard lightning connection.
